cause.description:
The American Anti-Slavery Group (AASG) is a nonprofit organization that works with former victims of human trafficking to abolish modern-day slavery, focusing primarily on systems of chattel slavery in Sudan and Mauritania. Through awareness-raising, advocacy, grassroots activism and direct aid, we fight for the freedom of millions held in bondage around the world.
2007 marks the 200th anniversary of the abolition of the trans-Atlantic slave trade - and yet experts estimate that today there are 27 million people enslaved around the world – more than were taken from Africa in the four centuries of the slave trade.
Join our group as well! http://brandeis.facebook.com/group.php?gid=2213570004
For the latest anti-slavery news: http://iabolish.blogspot.com/
1. Slavery isn't history.
